document_data.name: ''Palm Sign Amulet''
document_data.creator: [[Martek]]
document_data.refs1e: The powers and price of the amulet aren't made explicit in ''Desert of Desolation''; this article, however, assumes the stats in the original, non-Realms trilogy are likely analogous just as most of the other properties are.
document_data.mainbody: The '''''palm sign amulet''''' was one of a pair of such [[amulet]]s worn as badges of office by the [[Sheikh]]s in the [[Oasis of the White Palm]] in [[Raurin]]. They were gifted to their ancestors by [[Martek]]; as part of his prophecy to defeat [[Khalitharius]], they were meant to release [[Aeraldoth]].
document_data.Description: When put over the palm of a woman who bore the ''palm mark'', the amulet would reveal a message.{{cite book/Desert of Desolation|62-63}}
document_data.Powers: In the presence of Khalitharius, the amulet would rebuke him with a beam of cold, blue light.{{cite book/Desert of Desolation|84}} Otherwise, the amulet might have acted as a ''[[ring of fire resistance]]'' until Aeraldoth was released.
document_data.History:
After sealing Khalitharius, Martek gave the ''amulets'' to the leader of the [[Durpari]] in the area of the Oasis of the White Palm. They became badges of office passed down the generations. By the {{YearlinkName|1356}}, their true purpose had been largely forgotten.

In that year, an amulet may have been used to drive away Khalitharius after his kidnapping of princess [[Shadalah]]. By putting it against her palm, however, the way to release Aeraldoth was revealed.
